intro: Lolium multiflorum var. italicum, commonly known as Italian ryegrass, is a cool-season grass native to Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its fine, dark green blades and dense growth habit, making it a popular choice for forage and turfgrass. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a fibrous root system that aids in soil stabilization. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in agricultural settings due to its high nutritional value for livestock. Its rapid establishment and ability to withstand grazing make it a versatile and economically important plant.
